title: A Regional Services Hub of South Asia
snippet: Sri Lanka is embarking on mega projects which aim to position the island nation as a regional services hub of South Asia. While Sri Lanka is facing an acute economic crisis, it continues to expand its national projects such as the Colombo Port City development project.

snippet: SLT-MOBITEL, the national ICT solution services provider, joining hands with the Sri Lanka Chamber of Tourism and Industry conducted a women empowerment program in Arugam Bay recently, in line with the International Women's Day 2022.

title: Sri Lanka's oldest cricket club Colombo Malay CC begins 150th anniversary celebrations

title: Ukrainians in Galle protest against Russian invasion
snippet: A group of Ukrainians staged a protest in Galle Fort yesterday (24) demanding an end to the war launched by Russia against their country. More than a hundred Ukrainians stationed in and around Galle took part in the protest.

title: Criminalisation of same-sex sexual activity in Sri Lanka breached rights of a LGBTI activist, UN women's rights committee says

title: Allianz Lanka partners with oDoc to create value for customers
snippet: In order to create value for customers and provide convenient, affordable and hassle-free service, Allianz Lanka has announced a landmark, 1-year partnership with oDoc, Sri Lanka's largest digital health company.

title: Govt. urgently allocates Rs. 100Mn to import 14 critical drugs
snippet: A sum of Rs. 100 million has been allocated for the import of 14 critical drugs in a bid to address the acute shortage of drugs in the country. ..

title: Sri Lanka should set up a currency board to stop rupee depreciation: US economist
snippet: Sri Lanka should set up a currency board to stop further currency falls, US economist Steve Hanke has said as the island's currency collapsed from 203 to 290 to the US dollar in an attempt to float the currency which has not yet succeeded.

title: Banks, finance companies improve asset quality defying forecasts and expectations
snippet: Defying many forecasts and expectations, banks and finance companies have managed to do better on their asset quality parameters in 2021 even amid the worst economic conditions that prevailed due to the COVID resurgence and foreign currency troubles.

title: National Grid to get 200 MW from '' Sobadanavi'' by next year: Pavithra
snippet: The Power Ministry is hoping to add 200 MW of electricity to the national grid through the 350 MW Sobadanavi Natural Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LNG) Power Plant by next year, Minister Pavithra Wanniarachchi said.

title: CB and FinMin stress stability of banking system in joint statement
snippet: Responding to comments by Opposition MP Dr.Harsha de Silva in parliament yesterday about speculations that a State bank had defaulted payment, the Central Bank and the Finance Ministry in a joint statement denied such claims.

title: Harsha slams Cabraal, Monetary Board over failure to respond to parliament
snippet: The Opposition lawmaker Dr. Harsha de Silva yesterday slammed Central Bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal and the members of the Monetary Board for failing to appear before the Committee on Public Finance of parliament.

title: Treasury bills now offer nearly twice what banks pay for term deposits

title: Ukraine claims it destroyed Russian ships in occupied port
snippet: Ukraine said its armed forces had destroyed the Russian landing ship "Orsk" near the Russian-occupied Ukrainian port of Berdyansk on the Azov Sea. Deputy Defence Minister Hanna Malyar said the ship was capable of carrying 45 armoured personnel carriers and 400 people.

title: Changyong Rhee to retire from IMF after Sri Lanka visit
snippet: South Korea on Wednesday nominated veteran International Monetary Fund official Changyong Rhee as its new central bank chief, a pick who is widely expected to continue the bank's efforts to curb inflation with aggressive interest rate hikes.

title: Proposed train fare hike in Sri Lanka temporarily blocked: transport minister
snippet: Sri Lanka's transport ministry has temporarily blocked a proposed train fare hike after media reports emerged of a sudden increase effective midnight Thursday (24), Transport Minister Dilum Amunugama said.

title: Responsibility of offering high level of hospitality to tourists lies with SLTDA- Prez
snippet: As the slowly recovering tourism sector is struggling to carry out operations in a smooth manner given the economic challenges faced by the country, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa yesterday pointed out it is the responsibility of the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) to iron out issues.

title: WB support sought alongside IMF loan programme- sources
snippet: Sri Lanka will seek World Bank assistance to stave off a severe economic crisis in addition to an International Monetary Fund (IMF) rescue plan to be discussed next month, two sources said. ..

title: Japanese Ambassador to join in national tree planting auspicious Time on April 18
snippet: Japanese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Mizukoshi Hideaki said that the Ministry of Environment highly appreciates the Husma Dena Thuru  Tree Planting Program launched by Sri Lanka to enhance Sri Lanka's forest cover.

title: India to send 40,000 tonnes of diesel to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
snippet: India has acceded to a request from Sri Lanka to urgently provide a consignment of diesel in addition to monthly fuel supplies under a $500-million line of credit to tide over a severe shortage amid the island nation's economic crisis.

title: Australian cricket team to tour Sri Lanka in June
snippet: Australia's national men's cricket team will arrive in Sri Lanka to play an all format cricket series during June - July 2022. The Australians will play 03 T20Is, 05 ODIs, and 02 Test Matches during the tour.

title: Australia's all-format tour of Sri Lanka confirmed for June and July 2022
snippet: The all-format tour of Australia men's team to Sri Lanka has been confirmed to happen in June and July this year. It will be for the first time since 2016 when Australia will be touring Sri Lanka. The tour will begin with three T20Is followed by five ODIs,
